Please connect a device Reading board type… Menu title Short description of menu tile Info Enable Location disabled Bluetooth permissions denied Location service On some Android phones you have to enable Location service in order to scan for Bluetooth Low Energy devices. If you can\'t find any Bluetooth devices, please ensure you have enabled Location service. Location permission In order for this app to use the Location service, you have to grant a permission first. Please keep in mind, that on some Android devices this service is needed for proper Bluetooth Low Energy device discovery. Bluetooth permissions Since Android 12, performing BLE-related operations (such as scanning, advertising or connecting) requires the user to explicitly grant the \"Nearby devices\" permission for the app. Please keep in mind that this app relies heavily on these system features and its capabilities will be severely reduced without them. Utilize this device as a Bluetooth \n Low Energy peripheral View readings from the Health Thermometer service View info about nearby devices and their properties. Control a Dynamic Multiprotocol application of connected lights and switches Evaluate the link budget and range of EFR32 Measure throughput between the mobile device and EFR32 Control LED and receive button presses on a Silabs kit Exercise common Bluetooth operations with Silicon Labs hardware and software. Allows you to create a local GATT database. Rename characteristic Rename service Name field cannot be empty! Read Remote (Client) Local (Server) CONNECTION FAILED Connecting… Loading… Refreshing services… Rebooting firmware… Unknown Hex ASCII Decimal Unknown service Bluetooth 5 Advertising Extension Data Status: Primary PHY: Secondary PHY: Advertising Set ID: Tx Power: Periodic Advertising Interval: Not Present Complete Truncated LE 1M LE 2M LE Coded Unused The UUID dictionary contains the 128-bit UUIDs for services and characteristics that have been renamed by the user. The main purpose is simple consultation but it is also possible to change or delete them from this view. When deleted, the 128-bit UUIDs will again be shown as \"Unknown Service\" or \"Unknown Characteristic\" in the connected device\'s info screen. Choosing the \"No timeout\" option will result in ending the scan only when leaving the \"Scan\" feature or the app itself. 15 seconds 1 minute 2 minutes 5 minutes 10 minutes No timeout Bluetooth-related permissions are needed for this app Example: ESL Demo Add/commission ESL tags by scanning its QR code and control them from the UI ESL Network Scan QR code Refresh ESL Tags Scan QR code QR scan error: %s QR code not recognized Device terminated connection: status = %d Scan QR codes to discover \nand control ESL Tags No tags configured Group control Configured tags Turn on LED Upload a new image Display image on WSTK LCD screen Tag info icon Unknown state Error trying to connect ESL Tag Error trying to configure ESL Tag Error trying to ping the ESL Tag ESL Tag disconnected successfully Error trying to disconnect ESL Tag Finished sending an image to the ESL Tag Image transfer failed Display image failed Display image succeeded ESL operation timeout Basic State Response The ESL has detected a condition that needs service The ESL is synchronized to the AP The ESL has an active LED state: index %d The ESL has a timed LED update pending The ESL has a timed display update pending Reserved for future use Connecting the ESL Tag… Configuring the ESL Tag… Disconnecting the ESL Tag… Loading tags info… Pinging the ESL Tag… ESL Tag connected Do you wish to configure the connected ESL Tag? Configure Tag is already provisioned Upload a new image Select a slot on the ESL Access Point to which you wish to upload the new image. Choosing an occupied slot will result in overwriting the stored image with the new one. Display the image after uploading Image to upload: Display image Select an image you wish to display on the ESL Tag\'s LCD screen. Note: presented images info may be outdated if you controlled the ESL Access Point outside of this app (e.g. through the Command Line Interface). Notes: The recommended image size is below 100KB. \n The presented images info may be outdated if you controlled the ESL Access Point outside of this app (e.g. through the Command Line Interface).
